The **gray ooze**, P, is a weak [amoeboid](/wiki/Amoeboid "Amoeboid") [NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack") monster. It is extremely slow, but its bite causes [rusting](/wiki/Rust "Rust") and can damage [iron](/wiki/Iron "Iron") armor if it manages to land an attack.

As an [acidic](/wiki/Acid "Acid") monster, the gray ooze is capable of dissolving a [spider](/wiki/Spider "Spider") [web](/wiki/Web "Web"). Unlike [brown](/wiki/Brown_pudding "Brown pudding") and [black puddings](/wiki/Black_pudding "Black pudding"), it will not divide when you hit it without killing it.

Like all [puddings](/wiki/Pudding "Pudding"), gray oozes leave a [glob](/wiki/Glob "Glob") instead of a corpse. This can be eaten like a corpse, and may become tainted, but never fully rots away. The glob is acidic and has a chance of conveying [fire](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance"), [cold](/wiki/Cold_resistance "Cold resistance"), or [poison](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance") resistance. Eating a glob of gray ooze preserves [vegetarian conduct](/wiki/Conduct#Vegetarian "Conduct") but violates [vegan conduct](/wiki/Conduct#Vegan "Conduct").

## Strategy

By the time you encounter a gray ooze, you should be more than capable of defeating it easily, unless you are a [Tourist](/wiki/Tourist "Tourist"). Its rusting attack and ability to pass under doors makes this monster more annoying than dangerous.

It's best to take gray oozes out with ranged attacks as they are very slow, if not persistent. If you lack the means to kill it from afar and don't want to expend a wand's charge on it, let your pet deal with it. If all else fails, you could punch it to death after unequipping all iron equipment. Only do this if it is safe to do so, i.e. there aren't any other monsters nearby.

## History

In [NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3") and earlier, gray oozes left a corpse instead of a glob when killed.

In NetHack 3.6.0, globs could not give resistances when eaten. This was fixed in 3.6.1.

## Encyclopedia entry

- *See the [encyclopedia entry for amoeboid](/wiki/Amoeboid#Encyclopedia_entry "Amoeboid").*

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.4. Click here for more information.](/images/3/37/Nh364-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.4. Click here for more information.")

**This page may need to be updated for the [current version](/wiki/Current_version "Current version") of *NetHack*.**

It may contain text specific to [NetHack 3.6.4](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.4 "NetHack 3.6.4"). Information on this page may be out of date.

**Editors:** After reviewing this page and making necessary edits, please change the {{nethack-364}} tag to the current version's tag or {{noversion}} as appropriate.
html:
Gray ooze

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
P gray ooze
Difficulty 4
Attacks Bite 2d8 rusting
P gray ooze
Difficulty 4
Attacks

Bite 2d8 rusting

Base level 3
Base experience 28
Speed 1
Base AC 8
Base MR 0
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 2 (Quite rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 500
Nutritional value 250
Size Medium
Resistances fire, cold, poison, acid, petrification
Resistances conveyed fire (7%), cold (7%), poison (7%)

A gray ooze:

  • can flow under doors.
  • does not breathe.
  • has no eyes.
  • has no limbs.
  • has no head.
  • is mindless.
  • is acidic to eat.
  • is omnivorous.
  • is neither male nor female.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • never leaves a corpse.
Reference monst.c#line1682

The gray ooze, P, is a weak amoeboid NetHack monster. It is extremely slow, but its bite causes rusting and can damage iron armor if it manages to land an attack.

As an acidic monster, the gray ooze is capable of dissolving a spider web. Unlike brown and black puddings, it will not divide when you hit it without killing it.

Like all puddings, gray oozes leave a glob instead of a corpse. This can be eaten like a corpse, and may become tainted, but never fully rots away. The glob is acidic and has a chance of conveying fire, cold, or poison resistance. Eating a glob of gray ooze preserves vegetarian conduct but violates vegan conduct.

Strategy

By the time you encounter a gray ooze, you should be more than capable of defeating it easily, unless you are a Tourist. Its rusting attack and ability to pass under doors makes this monster more annoying than dangerous.

It's best to take gray oozes out with ranged attacks as they are very slow, if not persistent. If you lack the means to kill it from afar and don't want to expend a wand's charge on it, let your pet deal with it. If all else fails, you could punch it to death after unequipping all iron equipment. Only do this if it is safe to do so, i.e. there aren't any other monsters nearby.

History

In NetHack 3.4.3 and earlier, gray oozes left a corpse instead of a glob when killed.

In NetHack 3.6.0, globs could not give resistances when eaten. This was fixed in 3.6.1.

Encyclopedia entry

See the encyclopedia entry for amoeboid.


This page may need to be updated for the current version of NetHack.

It may contain text specific to NetHack 3.6.4. Information on this page may be out of date.

The '''gray ooze''', {{monsym|gray_ooze}}, is a weak [[amoeboid]] [[NetHack]] monster.  It is extremely slow, but its bite causes [[rust]]ing and can damage [[iron]] armor if it manages to land an attack. 

As an [[acid]]ic monster, the gray ooze is capable of dissolving a [[spider]] [[web]]. Unlike [[Brown pudding|brown]] and [[black pudding]]s, it will not divide when you hit it without killing it.

Like all [[pudding]]s, gray oozes leave a [[glob]] instead of a corpse. This can be eaten like a corpse, and may become tainted, but never fully rots away. The glob is acidic and has a chance of conveying [[Fire resistance|fire]], [[Cold resistance|cold]], or [[Poison resistance|poison]] resistance. Eating a glob of gray ooze preserves [[Conduct#Vegetarian|vegetarian conduct]] but violates [[Conduct#Vegan|vegan conduct]].

== Strategy ==
By the time you encounter a gray ooze, you should be more than capable of defeating it easily, unless you are a [[Tourist]]. Its rusting attack and ability to pass under doors makes this monster more annoying than dangerous. 

It's best to take gray oozes out with ranged attacks as they are very slow, if not persistent. If you lack the means to kill it from afar and don't want to expend a wand's charge on it, let your pet deal with it. If all else fails, you could punch it to death after unequipping all iron equipment. Only do this if it is safe to do so, i.e. there aren't any other monsters nearby.

==History==
In [[NetHack 3.4.3]] and earlier, gray oozes left a corpse instead of a glob when killed.

In NetHack 3.6.0, globs could not give resistances when eaten. This was fixed in 3.6.1.
